Detailed Description

The PCM Interface.

Pulse-code modulation(PCM)

The PCM group TAPI is to set the Realtek in-house PCM controller. It supports up to 8 ~ 16 PCM channels which support 8/16K sampling rate, and 32 PCM time slots are provided. A-law, mu-law 8-bit companding and 16-bit linear mode are supported.

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_EnablePcm ( uint32  chid,
uint32  val 
)

To disable or enable PCM channel as Narrowband/Wideband.

Parameters
chidThe channel number
valConfig value
Config value Description
0 Disable PCM
1 Enable PCM as Narrowband
2 Enable PCM as Wideband
Return values
0Success
Examples:
caller_id.c.

int32 rtk_SetPcmTimeslot ( uint32  chid,
uint32  timeslot1,
uint32  timeslot2 
)

Set PCM timeslot.

Parameters
chidThe channel number
timeslot1PCM timeslot 1
Available range: 0 to 31.
timeslot2PCM timeslot 2 (Wideband channel only)
Available range: 0 to 31.
Note
Some informations for setting timeslot1 and timeslot2 are listed in table below.
Other slot limitations may depend on the specifications of SLIC/DAA or other PCM slave device.

Bus Format Slot number required Slot limitation
NB Liner 2 Slot must set to even number
NB A-law 1 NO
NB A-law 1 NO
WB Liner 4 Slot must set to even number
WB A-law 2 NO
WB A-law 2 NO
Return values
0Success
